text: Canal+ (formerly MRTV-4 International and 4TV) is a Burmese multichannel television service operated through a joint venture between Forever Group in Myanmar and Canal+ Group in France. Originally launched by Forever Group alone, Canal+ Group joined in the business in 2017, and the service adopted the current name on January 29, 2018. Canal+ delivers the service through the digital terrestrial television (DTT) signals (available in Yangon and Mandalay) and direct-to-home (DTH) satellite television signals (beamed through Thaicom 6). It launched a Burmese version of My Canal OTT television service in 2019. There are 80 television channels, including nine in-house television channels, available on the platform. ==History== Previous logo as MRTV-4 International ==In-house channels== *Canal+ Kyi Lite : a TV Guide Channel. * Canal+ Gita: a music channel.အားတီနဲ့အတူ ထူးခြားတဲ့တင်ဆက်မှုတွေရှိမယ်ဆိုတဲ့ အမွန်း – Celebrities – Cele YatKwat – Duwun * Canal+ Action: an action film channel.ကင်မရာအရှေ့မှာ အလုပ်လုပ်နေရရင်ပျော်တယ်ဆိုတဲ့ မေမြတ်နိုး – Celebrities – Cele YatKwat – Duwun * Canal+ Ha Ha!: a comedy channel. * Canal+ Pu Tu Tue: a channel targeting preschoolers. * Canal+ Sports: a sports channel. * Canal+ Cha Tate: a channel targeting children and teenagers. * Canal+ Mae Madi: a drama channel aimed at female audiences. * Canal+ Zat Lenn: a film channel. * Canal+ Su Sann: a documentary channel.အစီအစဉ်တင်ဆက်သူအဖြစ် မြင်တွေ့ရဦးမယ့် မေဘရဏီသော် – Celebrities – Cele YatKwat – Duwun ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Mass media in Myanmar Category:Television channels in Myanmar Category:Direct broadcast satellite services Category:Mass media in Yangon
title: Canal+ (Myanmar)
